content: p1 pm k3 section 1 introducing your colours in this section we are going to use all 3 of the colours making easy garter stitch stripes to introduce cc1 and cc2 there are two types of stitches used in this sections stockinette and garter stripe and each is worked over 2 row stockinette row 1 rs k3 sm m1l k to next m m1r sm s1wyib sm m1l k to next m m1r sm k3 4 sts increased row 2 ws k3 purl to last 3 sts slipping the markers as you come to them k3 garter stripe row 1 rs k3 sm m1l k to next m m1r sm s1wyib sm m1l k to next m m1r sm k3 4 sts increased row 2 ws knit all sts slipping the markers as you come to them with mc work the 2 row of stockinette 10 times and do not cut mc 49 sts with cc1 work the 2 row of garter stripe once and cut cc1 53 sts with mc work the 2 row of stockinette 3 time and do not cut mc 65 sts with cc2 work the 2 row of garter stripe once and cut cc2 69 sts with mc work the 2 row of stockinette 3 time and do not cut mc 81 sts with cc1 work the 2 row of garter stripe once and cut cc1 85 sts with mc work the 2 row of stockinette 3 time and do not cut mc 97 sts with mc work the 2 row of garter stripe and cut mc 101 sts section 2 simple lace with cc2 row 1 rs k3 sm m1l k to next m m1r sm s1wyib sm m1l k to next m m1r sm k3 105 sts row 2 ws k3 purl to last 3 sts slipping the markers as you come to them k3 row 3-10 work row 1 to 8 of chart a remember to k3 on either side of the chart for both right and wrong side row work the repeats in the red box till you have the number of stitches shown on the chart before the next stitch marker cut
